alert.note: Alert for Catawba; Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 12:19AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Catawba and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to persistent, slowly-moving showers and thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour in this area and an additional inch will be possible through 1 am EDT. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Maiden, Westport, Denver and tributaries to Lake Norman. Flooding will be most likely along Lippard Creek, Ballard Creek, and Wilkinson Creek. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
